00016 /*-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00017  * File:    df.h
00018  * Purpose: header file for HDF routines
00019  * Invokes: dfi.h
00020  * Contents:
00021  *  Structure definitions: DFddh, DFdd, DFdesc, DFdle, DF, DFdi, DFdata
00022  *  Procedure type definitions
00023  *  Global variables
00024  *  Tag definitions
00025  *  Error return codes
00026  *  Logical constants
00027  * Remarks: This file is included with user programs
00028  *          Since it includes stdio.h etc., do not include these after df.h
00029  *---------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00030 
00031 #ifndef DF_H    /* avoid re-inclusion */
00032 #define DF_H
00033 
00034 #include "H4api_adpt.h"
00035 
00036 /* include DF (internal) header information */
00037 #include "hdf.h"
00038 
00039 /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00040 /*                      Type declarations                                   */
00041 
00042 typedef struct DFddh
00043   {                             /*format of data descriptor headers in file */
00044       int16       dds;          /* number of dds in header block */
00045       int32       next;         /* offset of next header block */
00046   }
00047 DFddh;
00048 
00049 typedef struct DFdd
00050   {                             /* format of data descriptors as in file */
00051       uint16      tag;          /* data tag */
00052       uint16      ref;          /* data reference number */
00053       int32       offset;       /* offset of data element in file */
00054       int32       length;       /* number of bytes */
00055   }
00056 DFdd;
00057 
00058 /* descriptor structure is same as dd structure.  ###Note: may be changed */
00059 typedef DFdd DFdesc;
00060 
00061 /* DLE is the internal structure which stores data descriptor information */
00062 /* It is a linked list of DDs */
00063 typedef struct DFdle
00064   {                             /* Data List element */
00065       struct DFdle *next;       /* link to next dle */
00066       DFddh       ddh;          /* To store headers */
00067       DFdd        dd[1];        /* dummy size */
00068   }
00069 DFdle;
00070 
00071 /* DF is the internal structure associated with each DF file */
00072 /* It holds information associated with the file as a whole */
00073 /* ### Note: there are hooks for having multiple DF files open at a time */
00074 typedef struct DF
00075   {
00076       DFdle      *list;         /* Pointer to the DLE list */
00077       DFdle      *last_dle;     /* last_dle and last_dd are used in searches */
00078       /* to indicate element returned */
00079       /* by previous call to DFfind */
00080       DFdd       *up_dd;        /* DD of element being read/updated, */
00081       /* used by DFstart */
00082       uint16      last_tag;     /* Last tag searched for by DFfind */
00083       uint16      last_ref;     /* Last reference number searched for */
00084       intn        type;         /* 0= not in use, 1= normal, -1 = multiple */
00085       /* this is a hook for when */
00086       /* multiple files are open */
00087       intn        access;       /* permitted access types: */
00088       /* 0=none, 1=r, 2=w, 3=r/w */
00089       intn        changed;      /* True if anything in DDs modified */
00090       /* since last write */
00091       intn        last_dd;      /* see last_dle */
00092       intn        defdds;       /* default numer of DD's in each block */
00093       intn        up_access;    /* access permissions to element being */
00094       /* read/updated. Used by DFstart */
00095       /* File handle is a file pointer or file descriptor depending on whether */
00096       /* we use buffered or unbuffered I/O.  But, since this structure is a */
00097       /* fake, it doesn't matter whether I/O is buffered or not. */
00098       intn        file;         /* file descriptor */
00099   }
00100 DF;
00101 
00102 typedef struct DFdata
00103   {                             /* structure for returning status information */
00104       int32       version;      /* version number of program */
00105   }
00106 DFdata;
00107

00209 int DFerror;            /* Error code for DF routines */
